main event: A cigar-shaped pale yellow flame was observed going straight up, then veering to the northeast, turning, and flying south while continuing to climb.
interesting points: The object was described as a cigar-shaped flame, with the exhaust being all that the observer saw, and not the object itself.
The object flew at a 45-degree angle, then turned and flew straight up towards the northeast, before turning and flying south.
The observation lasted for about 3 minutes.
The observer, a senior government analyst with the city of Detroit, was previously employed by Chrysler Missile and was certain the object was not a fireworks display or an aircraft.
The report comes from Project Blue Book, a United States Air Force project that investigated unidentified flying objects (UFOs).
